com.yantra.api.inv

Interface getSupplyDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface getSupplyDetails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getSupplyDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getSupplyDetails API obtains an inventory picture for an item on each node.

    • Method Detail

      • getSupplyDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getSupplyDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getSupplyDetails API obtains an inventory picture for an item on each node. The inventory picture contains current inventory and incoming inventory due to purchase orders. The getSupplyDetails API can be used to determine if proper supply is available for sourcing. The output XML provides details on supply and demand.

        A ship node level element provides details on maximum quantity available from a ship node. This takes into consideration only demands which have a ship node specified on them. The supply for an item at a ship node is provided in two elements: ExactAttributeMatchedDemands and SoftAllocatedDemands. Supply is listed under ExactAttributeMatchedDemands if the Demand\TagNumber and ShipNode match against the supply. Otherwise, supply is listed under SoftAllocatedDemands.

        If there is a description of the Item which is based on the Locale for where the API is invoked, then the Item\LanguageDescriptionList\LanguageDescription element is returned.

        Partial tag information can be passed in the input as the tag criteria. The API will retrieve the supply details of all inventory items with tag criteria that matches the partial tag criteria from the input.

        The API will return the unmatched demand information for the demand with no matching supply for each node.

        Availability of Model Items
        When inquiring for availability of a model item, the availability will be based on the availability of the items whom define their model parent to be the requested item. The model item's availability is the total availability of its children. The ItemFilter element can be passed to determine which model children items should be considered in availability. For example, specifying an ItemFilter with the ColorCode attribute specified will only consider those children's availability if the item matches the requested ColorCode. Extended attributes of the YFS_ITEM table are also supported.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Additional Information:
        API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.
        Note that when determining which supplies are available, this API will not consider safety factors, and bundle parents will not consider children.

        Integration with Inventory Visibility (phase 2.0) enabled:
        Features not supported in IV- availability by tag, segment, items with variation, GTIN, VMI, time-sensitive breakdown, multi-brand won't be supported.
        User exits com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE won't be supported with IV integration.
        Instead of reading supplies and demands from IV, node availability api of IV shall be invoked and the availabilities at node/s will be modelled as supplies.
        In the api input xml, ConsiderUnassignedDemand, ConsiderAllSegments, Tag won't be supported.
        Api output will not provide demand data.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output xml files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
